description.narrative: Plan Finland?s communications highlights child rights in the public discussion on development cooperation and informs various target audiences of its results. This way, it also maintains interest towards development cooperation and helps understand why thi s work is needed and which principles are guiding it. Communications focuses on the core thematic and geographic areas of Plan?s programmes. It draws material from Plan?s international network and makes use of programme countries? grassroots experience as well as the broad report and research database, providing linkages for understanding projects as part of a larger context. Programme work is promoted through press releases and seminars on current issues in both Finnish and Swedish. The website provides in formation on each of Plan Finland?s projects and presents news on its key themes, including education, early childhood care and development, child protection and the challenges of youth employment.Plan?s communications actively produces background material related to the programmes and the topics they address, launches reports and publishes a biannual journal Maailman Kuva, focusing on development issues and child rights. A broad audience is also reached through newsletters and the social media. Journalists are serviced through technical and professional support when they are visiting Plan?s programmes.Advocacy work in Finland is equally supported by communications. The international Day of the Girl in October and the related media attention create visibilit y on e.g. girls? education, both as a core thematic area of Plan?s programmes and as part of its advocacy work. Op-eds by Plan?s specialists are regularly being published in various media with the support of communications.
